titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States with respect to the expenditure of money to elect public officials.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Declares that the expenditure of money for the election of public officials is not protected speech under the First Amendment to the Constitution.
